newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares ease, lacking momentum.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares ease, lacking momentum.

text.p: Austrian shares followed international mood swings on Monday, ending 0.44 percent down after shedding early modest gains.
The blue-chip ATX index closed 5.74 points lower at 1,298.0, with 13 losers outnumbering seven gainers. One issue was unchanged. Earlier the ATX had touched an intra-day high of 1,310.45 points.

"Early on we followed the international lead higher. Then sentiment changed and we headed back down again," a trader said, adding that Vienna would probably continue its downward path on Tuesday if the dollar remained weak.

Market participants were divided on the technical outlook. Some painted a bearish picture after support at 1,305 points failed to hold. Others cherished the hope of a rally back above the key 1,300 level.
ATX heavyweight OMV was the day's biggest decliner. The oil and gas group group slid 2.15 pct to 1,534 schillings.

Brick maker Wienerberger finished 16 schillings higher at 2,537 after the company announced it was selling its Treibacher Schleifmittel abrasive materials unit to a German industrialist group for an undisclosed sum.
Analysts welcomed the sale as a canny move.
Preferred shares in Bank Austria were the top gainer, rebounding 1.68 percent to 400.10 schillings after last week's sharp falls.

In the secondary market, water purification company BWT shot to an all-time high of 1,900 schillings before easing back to 1,850, 21 schillings up on the day. Traders noted the share succeeded in breaking through heavy resistance last week.
June ATX futures stood 10.5 points down at 1,296.5. The broad-based Vienna bourse index ended 1.74 points down at 476.88. -- Vienna newsroom, +43-1 531 12 254
